topic: How to document event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Documenting Event-Driven Systems with FastAPI in Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This explainer provides a comprehensive guide on how to document event-driven systems using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. It covers important aspects such as defining events, handling event subscriptions, and incorporating documentation for better maintainability and readability.",
  "key_points": [
    "Understanding Event-Driven Systems",
    "FastAPI Overview",
    "Defining Events and Event Handlers",
    "Setting Up FastAPI Routes for Events",
    "Documenting Event-Driven APIs with FastAPI",
    "Integrating Third-Party Libraries for Event Handling (e.g., Celery, Pydub) if applicable"
  ],
  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```python\nfrom fastapi import FastAPI\napp = FastAPI()\n@app.on_event('test_event')\ndef event_handler(event: dict):\n    print(event)``"
    }
  ],
  "version_notes": [
    "FastAPI 0.65.0 introduced support for event-based APIs",
    "Python 3.12.x has yet to be released; this explainer provides guidance based on the latest stable Python version (3.11.x)"
  ],
  "caveats": [
    "Ensure your events are well-defined and self-contained",
    "Use clear, concise comments and docstrings for event handlers and APIs",
    "Keep in mind that documentation is an ongoing process and should be updated regularly"
  ]
}
